channel.title: Strategy on Filippo Sanzeni
channel.description: Recent content in Strategy on Filippo Sanzeni

item.title: On Designifying AI
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: OpenAI’s $6.4B acquisition of Jony Iveâ€™s io merges minimalist design with AI surveillance capitalism, wrapping monopolistic data extraction in sleek packaging. A masterclass in enshittification.

item.title: On The Paradox of Protectionism
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: Could blitzkrieg protectionism somehow offer a (tentative) scaffolding for local growth?

item.title: On Overusing Wicked Problems
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: I’ve got an itch to scratch regarding wicked problems and how often they can be an excuse for inaction

item.title: On The Innovator Myth
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: A deep dive, spurred by recent events (Deepseek, wink wink), on the different mental frameworks of innovation between the West and East. Yes, I’m simplifying.

item.title: On Tariffs and Globalisation
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: Tariffs have been a useful tool for protectionism. Up the 1920s. Perhaps today things are a little more complicated.

item.title: On Hardware Enshittification
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: A notoriusly good 3D printer manufacturer decided to alienate their customer base py pushing unnecessarily restrictive firmware updates.

item.title: On Risk Homeostasis
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: Jump into my latest rabbit hole: risk homeostasis theory, or, why we can rethink risk in strategy (and software development).

item.title: On Institutional Inertia
item.author: sanzenifilippo@gmail.com (Filippo Sanzeni)
item.description: How the pirates of Monkey Island can teach us about organisational inertia, or, why companies do not like change so much.
